attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash
set -ex

# -*- Setup variables
mysql_password="@@{MYSQL_PASSWORD}@@"

server_id=`sudo cat /etc/my.cnf.d/nutanix.cnf | grep  "server-id=" | cut -d= -f2`
is_master=`sudo cat /etc/my.cnf.d/nutanix.cnf | grep -q -w "#master=$server_id"; echo $?`

# -*- Run only on master
if [ ${is_master} -eq 0 ]
then
sudo sed -i "/\[mysqld\]/a innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit=1" /etc/my.cnf.d/nutanix.cnf
sudo sed -i "/\[mysqld\]/a sync_binlog=1" /etc/my.cnf.d/nutanix.cnf

sudo mysql -u root -p${mysql_password}<<EOF
CREATE USER 'replica'@'%' IDENTIFIED BY "${mysql_password}";
GRANT REPLICATION SLAVE ON *.* to replica@'%';
FLUSH PRIVILEGES;
EOF

fi

sudo touch /var/run/mysqld/mysqld.sock
sudo chown mysql:mysql /var/run/mysqld/mysqld.sock
sudo systemctl restart mysqld

sleep 5

#!/bin/bash

mysql_password="@@{MYSQL_PASSWORD}@@"
master_ip="@@{address}@@"

server_id=`sudo cat /etc/my.cnf.d/nutanix.cnf | grep  "server-id=" | cut -d= -f2`
is_master=`sudo cat /etc/my.cnf.d/nutanix.cnf | grep -q -w "#master=$server_id"; echo $?`


if [ ${is_master} -eq 0 ]
then
    while true
    do
      status=`sudo systemctl status mysqld | grep Active: | awk ' { print $3 }' | sed 's#[(|)]##g'`
  	  [ $status = "running" ] && break
      echo $status
  	  sleep 2
    done
    
    MYSQL_BIN=$(sudo mysql -u root -p${mysql_password} -e 'show master status;' | grep mysql-bin | awk '{print $1}')
	MYSQL_POSITION=$(sudo mysql -u root -p${mysql_password} -e 'show master status;' | grep mysql-bin | awk '{print $2}')
    
  echo "MYSQL_BIN=$MYSQL_BIN"
  echo "MYSQL_POSITION=$MYSQL_POSITION"
fi

#!/bin/bash

# -*- Setup variables
mysql_password="@@{MYSQL_PASSWORD}@@"
master_ip="@@{MySQL_Master.address}@@"
master_bin="@@{MySQL_Master.MYSQL_BIN}@@"
master_position="@@{MySQL_Master.MYSQL_POSITION}@@"

server_id=`sudo cat /etc/my.cnf.d/nutanix.cnf | grep  "server-id=" | cut -d= -f2`
is_master=`sudo cat /etc/my.cnf.d/nutanix.cnf | grep -q -w "#master=$server_id"; echo $?`

# -*- Runs on slaves
if [ ${is_master} -ne 0 ]
then
  sudo mysql -u root -p${mysql_password} -e "change master to master_host='${master_ip}',master_user='replica',master_password='${mysql_password}',master_log_file='${master_bin}',master_log_pos=${master_position};"
  sudo mysql -u root -p${mysql_password} -e 'start slave;'
  sudo mysql -u root -p${mysql_password} -e 'show slave status\G' | grep -A11 Slave_IO_State
fi

#!/bin/bash

set -ex

# Install Mysql
sudo yum update -y --quiet
sudo yum install -y  wget xfs* bc unzip lvm2* lsscsi

sudo sed -i 's/^SELINUX=.*/SELINUX=disabled/' /etc/sysconfig/selinux
sudo sed -i 's/^SELINUX=.*/SELINUX=disabled/' /etc/selinux/config
sudo setenforce 0

echo "System packages are installed"

#!/bin/bash

set -ex

##############
#
# LVM setup script for MySQL . 1 disk for DATA, 1 for LOGS and 1 for TMP
# Data disk is 500GB | Log disk is 50GB | Tmp disk is 25GB
#
#############


#PGSQL data
sudo pvcreate /dev/sdb
sudo vgcreate dev_vg-mysql_vg /dev/sdb
sudo lvcreate -l 100%FREE -i4 -I1M -n dev_vg-mysql_lv dev_vg-mysql_vg          ## Use 1MB to avoid IO amplification 
#lvcreate -l 100%FREE -i4 -I4M -n pgDataLV pgDataVG

#PGSQL logs
sudo pvcreate /dev/sdc
sudo vgcreate dev_vg-mysqllogs_vg /dev/sdc
sudo lvcreate -l 100%FREE -i2 -I1M -n dev_vg-mysqllogs_lv dev_vg-mysqllogs_vg           ## Use 1MB to avoid IO amplification
#lvcreate -l 100%FREE -i2 -I4M -n pgLogLV pgLogVG

#PGSQL tmp
sudo pvcreate /dev/sdd
sudo vgcreate dev_vg-mysqltmp_vg /dev/sdd
sudo lvcreate -l 100%FREE -i2 -I1M -n dev_vg-mysqltmp_lv dev_vg-mysqltmp_vg          ## Use 1MB to avoid IO amplification
#lvcreate -l 100%FREE -i2 -I4M -n pgLogLV pgLogVG


#Disable LVM read ahead
sudo lvchange -r 0 /dev/dev_vg-mysql_vg/dev_vg-mysql_lv
sudo lvchange -r 0 /dev/dev_vg-mysqllogs_vg/dev_vg-mysqllogs_lv
sudo lvchange -r 0 /dev/dev_vg-mysqltmp_vg/dev_vg-mysqltmp_lv


#Format LVMs with ext4 and use nodiscard to make sure format time is fast on Nutanix due to SCSI unmap
sudo mkfs.ext4 -E nodiscard /dev/dev_vg-mysql_vg/dev_vg-mysql_lv
sudo mkfs.ext4 -E nodiscard /dev/dev_vg-mysqllogs_vg/dev_vg-mysqllogs_lv
sudo mkfs.ext4 -E nodiscard /dev/dev_vg-mysqltmp_vg/dev_vg-mysqltmp_lv

sleep 10

#!/bin/bash

set -ex

sudo hostnamectl set-hostname "@@{HOST_NAME}@@"

# Install Mysql
sudo yum install -y --quiet "http://repo.mysql.com/mysql80-community-release-el7-3.rpm"
sudo yum update -y --quiet
sudo yum install -y --quiet sshpass mysql-community-server.x86_64

#!/bin/bash

set -ex

echo "!includedir /etc/my.cnf.d" | sudo tee -a /etc/my.cnf

echo "[mysqld]
binlog-format=mixed
log-bin=mysql-bin
datadir=/u/mysql
sql_mode=NO_ENGINE_SUBSTITUTION,STRICT_TRANS_TABLES
innodb_data_home_dir = /u/mysql
innodb_log_group_home_dir = /u/mysqllogs/log
innodb_file_per_table
tmpdir=/mysql/tmpdir
innodb_undo_directory = /u/mysql/undo
default-storage-engine = innodb
default_tmp_storage_engine = innodb
innodb_log_files_in_group = 4
innodb_log_file_size = 1G
innodb_log_buffer_size = 8M
innodb_buffer_pool_size = 6G	
large-pages	
innodb_buffer_pool_instances = 64	
innodb_flush_method=O_DIRECT	
innodb_flush_neighbors=0	 
innodb_flush_log_at_trx_commit=1
innodb_buffer_pool_dump_at_shutdown=1	
innodb_buffer_pool_load_at_startup=1	
bulk_insert_buffer_size = 256	
innodb_thread_concurrency = 16	
 	 
# Undo tablespace	 
innodb_undo_tablespaces = 5	
 	 
# Networking	 
wait_timeout=57600	 
max_allowed_packet=1G	
socket=/var/lib/mysql/mysql.sock	 
skip-name-resolve
port=3306	
max_connections=1000	


[mysqld_safe]
log-error=/u/mysqllogs/log/mysqld.log
pid-file=/var/run/mysqld/mysqld.pid" | sudo tee /etc/my.cnf.d/nutanix.cnf

sudo sed -i "/\[mysqld\]/a server-id=100" /etc/my.cnf.d/nutanix.cnf
echo "#master=100" | sudo tee -a  /etc/my.cnf.d/nutanix.cnf

server_id=`sudo cat /etc/my.cnf.d/nutanix.cnf | grep  "server-id=" | cut -d= -f2`
is_master=`sudo cat /etc/my.cnf.d/nutanix.cnf | grep -q -w "#master=$server_id"; echo $?`

if [ ${is_master} -ne 0 ]
then
   sudo sed -i '/\[mysqld\]/a read_only=1' /etc/my.cnf.d/nutanix.cnf
fi

# -*- Sysctl configuration
mysql_grp_id=`id -g mysql`
sudo sysctl -w vm.swappiness=0
sudo sysctl -w vm.nr_hugepages=1024
sudo sysctl -w vm.overcommit_memory=1
sudo sysctl -w vm.dirty_background_ratio=5 
sudo sysctl -w vm.dirty_ratio=15
sudo sysctl -w vm.dirty_expire_centisecs=500
sudo sysctl -w vm.dirty_writeback_centisecs=100
sudo sysctl -w vm.hugetlb_shm_group=$mysql_grp_id

echo "vm.swappiness=0
vm.nr_hugepages=1024
vm.overcommit_memory=1
vm.dirty_background_ratio=5 
vm.dirty_ratio=15
vm.dirty_expire_centisecs=500
vm.dirty_writeback_centisecs=100
vm.hugetlb_shm_group=$mysql_grp_id" | sudo tee  -a /etc/sysctl.conf

echo "ACTION=='add|change', SUBSYSTEM=='block', RUN+='/bin/sh -c \"/bin/echo 1024 > /sys%p/queue/max_sectors_kb\"'" | sudo tee /etc/udev/rules.d/71-block-max-sectors.rules

echo "/dev/mapper/dev_vg-mysql_lv /u/mysql ext4 rw,seclabel,noatime,nobarrier,stripe=4096,data=ordered 0 0" | sudo tee -a /etc/fstab
echo "/dev/mapper/dev_vg-mysqllogs_lv /u/mysqllogs/log ext4 rw,seclabel,noatime,nobarrier,stripe=4096,data=ordered 0 0" | sudo tee -a /etc/fstab
sudo mkdir -p /u/mysqllogs/log /u/mysql /u/mysqltmp /u/mysql/undo
sudo mount -a
sudo chown -R mysql:mysql /mysql

sudo systemctl enable mysqld

sudo rm -rf /u/mysql/data/*
sudo systemctl start mysqld

#Fix to obtain temp password and set it to blank
password=$(grep -oP 'temporary password(.*): \K(\S+)' /var/log/mysqld.log)
sudo mysqladmin --user=root --password="$password" password aaBB**cc1122
sudo mysql --user=root --password=aaBB**cc1122 -e "UNINSTALL COMPONENT 'file://component_validate_password'"
sudo mysqladmin --user=root --password="aaBB**cc1122" password ""


#Mysql secure installation
sudo mysql -u root<<-EOF
ALTER USER 'root'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED WITH caching_sha2_password BY '@@{MYSQL_PASSWORD}@@';
DELETE FROM mysql.user WHERE User='root' AND Host NOT IN ('localhost', '127.0.0.1', '::1');
DELETE FROM mysql.user WHERE User='';
DELETE FROM mysql.db WHERE Db='test' OR Db='test\_%';
FLUSH PRIVILEGES;
EOF

attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash

### Setup variables
mysql_password="@@{MYSQL_PASSWORD}@@"
date_part=`date +%F`
mkdir -p @@{BACKUP_FILE_PATH}@@
sudo mysqldump -u root -p${mysql_password} --all-databases | sudo gzip -9 > @@{BACKUP_FILE_PATH}@@/db_dump.sql.gz
